meanings.definition: Bizzes (noun): plural form of 'bizz', meaning a business or occupation.
meanings.sent1: Many bizzes in our town are small shops run by families.
meanings.sent2: She owns a successful bizzes selling handmade jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The cat's bizzes was to catch mice, but it ended up napping all day.
meanings.sent4: His bizzes was a ship sailing through the stormy seas of commerce.
meanings.sent5: The bustling bizzes of the city never seemed to sleep.

meanings.definition: Bizzes (verb): third person singular present of 'bizz', meaning to work energetically or busily.
meanings.sent1: He bizzes from dawn till dusk to finish his assignments.
meanings.sent2: The bees bizzes around the garden collecting nectar.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bizzes up and down the tree gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent4: Time bizzes by when you're having fun with friends.
meanings.sent5: She bizzes through her chores with a smile on her face.
